data.text: Are Padded Cycling Shorts Needed when Using Brooks Saddle?
BROOKS B17 USERS: Do you wear padded cycling shorts/bibs while on your Brooks?
sounds like a more comfortable seat would do better.....check the bikes used in holland.....
data.author: Philip Buckley

data.text: the b17 is incredibly comfortable. I have been using it for awhile and personally donâ€™t wear any padding. Just curious what others do.
data.author: Nick Johnson

data.text: learning and sharing.....that is the goal.....
data.author: Philip Buckley

data.text: My last 35,000kms has been on brooks b17, no padded shorts. Just some quickdry light weight seamless underpants.
data.author: Paul Hamon

data.text: Rode 164km yesterday on my brand new saddle, only been on my bike a week with no padded shorts. I weight 97kg and 6'2.
data.author: Paul Hamon

data.text: If you need padding while on a b17, then the b17 is not the right fit for you
data.author: Jake Klamerus

data.text: 80% of us are wrong eh ðŸ¤£
data.author: Johnny Pinkerton

data.text: Yep I guess the majority is wrong lol. Short rides I can go without. Longer rides I like the shorts because they if nothing else are simpler. I think they protect even more against chaffing though.
data.author: Natalie Stenger

data.text: Not always
data.author: Craig Macku

data.text: I used to but no longer use padded shorts.
data.author: Bill Santore

data.text: No need
data.author: Nuj Simon

data.text: On rides longer than an hour why wouldn't u want extra comfort???
data.author: Topher Nando

data.text: I did on this trip and it was a mistake. In my younger days my cycle shorts just had a chamois insert not padded or very big. I ride this last time with synthetic padding and they did rub somewhat. But had to continue as that's all I had. But I don't think they are needed with a b17
data.author: John Axson

data.text: I miss the real chamois, my Descentes had just that soft leather pad and no padding of any kind. The pillows that they stuff into shorts nowadays just can't compare. Odd that no one is trying to bring back leather. Maybe the supply of those cute little french mountain goats is just too small :(
data.author: Peter Harger

data.text: Just dont use brooks no padding needed ever
data.author: Menno Pieters

data.text: Nothing like a piece of padded foam and stretchy plastic keeping the air from your junk on a hot day
data.author: Tom Heutte

data.text:
Even betterâ€¦ a B-17 and NO SHORTS AT ALL https://www.worldnakedbikeride.org/
World Naked Bike Ride (WNBR) - Naked Bicycle People Power! Stop indecent exposure to vehicle emissions! (n)
worldnakedbikeride.org
data.author: Tom Heutte

data.text: eww
data.author: David J. Syrotiak

data.text: Some weirdos probably don't shave their legs either.
data.author: Simon Tomkins

data.text: open up a can of worms. I am big on trimming my leg hairs, expecially if it is hot. But completely shave is extreme, my legs look very white even when tanned, they look much more skinny then, and the hair is a sunblock and helps prevent getting scratched. But I support your sentiment about not wearing cycling shorts. Like some people wear those mtb pants, and I think like are you using the excuse because you want the pockets, or you just not in with things to know what works.
data.author: Brian Alexander Langton

data.text: I have done days of up to 80 miles and never needed padded shorts on my Brooks B17.
data.author: Stephen Shields

data.text: No because I sold my brooks
data.author: Aj Sake

data.text: From my limited experience of Brooks saddles I'd wear 2 pairs.....sorry but modern technology for me. I'll now take the abuse from the Brooks lovers.....ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
data.author: Dave Oakes

data.text: I ride b17 imperial and I abandoned chamois 1/2 thru a 1500 mile tour and never looked back.
data.author: Brandon Wasser

data.text: I'm over 250 pounds. That paltry piece of sponge ain't doing anything.
data.author: Eric Walters

data.text: Wouldn't touch Brooks again with a barge pole, padding or no padding.
data.author: David Farnsworth

data.text: interesting, what put you off them..? many people rave about them... but they always looked to me like hard chunks of old wood...
data.author: Peter Harger

data.text: Nerve damage in the nether regions. Took about 6 months to resolve.
data.author: David Farnsworth

data.text: sounds like you where unlucky compared to thousands of other Brooks users.
data.author: Stephen Shields

data.text: I fully accept that many people find them the bees wotsits. However, I know I'm not the only one that has suffered as a result of trying a Brooks.
data.author: David Farnsworth

data.text: someone posted a link recently that I saw wherein a someone from a major university (Harvard?) collected data on brooks users who had, uhm, nether regions problems... I think that maybe perhaps because brooks are comfortable, people sit down in them instead of perching on top of the saddle and moving around a lot.. exposing the nether regions to continuous pressure in key places...? just a guess and a thought...
data.author: Peter Harger

data.text: I've used numerous saddles over the years, including a different make of leather saddle, with no problems. I've tried Brooks twice and had the same issue both times. Maybe I have an odd anatomy. It's not an area of my body I find easy to examine.
data.author: David Farnsworth

data.text: Ah, Brooks. You either love them or hate them. (I have them on 3 of my bikes.)
data.author: Mike Kruger
